message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV. 

The paper deals with topic modeling, which is a subfield of natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning. The use of neural networks and embeddings also suggests a focus on deep learning and representation learning, which are common topics in the computer science sub-categories of cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the challenges of applying topic models to short texts and sparse corpora, which are relevant to information retrieval (cs.IR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the use of embeddings for a distributional prior could also be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) applications.
